case_vignette: A previously healthy 28-year-old man presents to the physician complaining of recent unintentional weight loss, flatulence, and foul-smelling stools. He reports having severe abdominal cramping that is worse in his right upper abdomen as well as intermittent bloody stools. He has experienced these symptoms since his return from a backpacking trip in Australia, one month ago. He is prescribed a medication and advised to refrain from alcohol consumption to avoid adverse effects of the drug.
question: Which  findings on pathology would most likely correspond to the patient’s diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've been experiencing unintentional weight loss, a lot of gas, and my stools have been really smelly. Also, I'm having severe stomach cramps, especially bad on the right upper side, and sometimes there's blood in my stool.
How old are you and what is your sex?
I'm a 28-year-old man.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing these symptoms since I came back from a backpacking trip in Australia, so about one month now.
Have you had any fevers or chills along with your current symptoms?
No, I haven't had any fevers or chills.
Have you noticed any changes in the color of your urine or any jaundice (yellowing of the skin or eyes)?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my urine color or yellowing of my skin or eyes.
Do you have any previous medical history or chronic illnesses?
No, I was previously healthy before these symptoms started.
Are you taking any medications currently or have you taken any since your symptoms began?
Yes, I was prescribed a medication by my doctor.
Can you please specify the medication prescribed to you by your doctor?
I'm sorry, but I don't remember the name of the medication.
Have you ever been diagnosed with any food intolerances, allergies, or gastrointestinal diseases?
No, I've never been diagnosed with any of those things.
Is there a history of gastrointestinal diseases such as Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, or colorectal cancer in your family?
I haven't mentioned any family history of gastrointestinal diseases, so I guess there's no such history.
Did you drink untreated water or eat any unusual or uncooked foods during your backpacking trip?
The vignette I provided doesn't mention if I drank untreated water or ate unusual or uncooked foods during the trip.

Final Diagnosis: Given the recent travel history, the symptoms of severe stomach cramps, especially on the right upper side, unintentional weight loss, increased gas, foul-smelling stools, and blood in stool, you may be suffering from a parasitic or bacterial infection and I would recommend seeing a healthcare professional immediately for evaluation, which will likely include stool tests and possibly blood work.
